@Goji I doubt it's something as realistic as a heat stroke. He didn't show any sign of anything remotely ill before his ghost-insect-mom showed up. If anything, it's more likely that the ghost swept his physical body away to a dream world and swept his spirit away by fucking him.

tl;dr nibba died of a heat stroke in August in the cemetery, and his last memories were of a mother he "shouldn't recall the face of" via mental recall in a heat stroke induced hallucination. Drink more water.

Darkwatcher10 has a likely close approximation based on the symbolism at the end. It's become pretty apparent that until his most recent works Regura implies an ending that is the most eerie/creep you out ending the scenario could have. In the beginning the father mentions the black butterfly symbolizes a departed soul. After the ending and MC is motionless laying on the apparition/monster girls lap (talking about them staying together forever) another black butterfly flies off over them. 

MC is most likely dead, and Regura leaves up up to reader to conclude whether he actually encountered the monster girl who resembled a "mother whose face he shouldn't recall" (see the numerous cultural tales of how one's memories flash before their eyes before death via mental recollection... including emotional long forgotten ones from youth of family) and either died during the encounter, or the events in the cemetery were a heat induced hallucination from a heat stroke (August = Obon/Bon festival

Ok. After reading this for the 8th time (also wanking to it for the 8th time), I can safely say that he's definitely not having sex with his mother, but a youkai that mimics his mother's face. Because we can see in the last page that he - as a kid - was sleeping in his mother's lap and there's a black moth flying over them. So I think that this black moth/youkai maybe fell in love with this kid, but she waits for him to grow up first before kidnapping him. The reason I call it kidnapping because it was clearly shown that he somehow just teleported into this house and even he himself wondered how he got there but he just brushed it off(as I would do too if there's a sexy moth girl wanting to fuck me). So that's it... An unnecessary analysis that I made over a hentai manga when I should've been working on my 8 page essay... What the hell am I doing with my life?? T___T

Well, there's a few ways you could look at that last panel, because of the final fade out boxes... Either the Apparition IS his mother, and that lullaby was meaningful and she had to return to the 'beyond' she came from, and then she came back years later and stole him away to said beyond (house teleport). Or, his mom was human and actually came back as an apparition, and something went wanky with it, so she ended up wanting more than just watching over him. OR, those last panels are meant to be creepy, and this is just an apparition that passed by when he was first visiting the grave with his dad, decided to haunt around him, then used all that it learned from doing that to pose as his mother's image, and steal him away for herself. Regardless, all of the above still makes for this being a happy ending, in my book anyway.
